section.name: Overview
section.p: This document describes the format and layout of source XMLs for Price Engine configuration processors. This includes the naming of source files, conventions for content, transformation stylesheets description.

All defined configuration sources are described in separate sections of this document. Please also refer to the Price Engine Components Configuration document that describes all kinds of configurations used for Price Engine components.

The root of configuration repository for Price Engine product is $REPO_HOME/com/baxter/pe directory on Configuration Server's file system. Here is a list of source files supported by PE configuration processors:
In addition to these configuration sources there can be configuration variant files. The variant conventions are described for each configuration source separately in sections below.

section.name: Logging Source
section.p: Logging source defines the configuration for logging frameworks such as Log4J or Logback. The same source is used to generate all types of final configuration.

subsection.p: The logging configuration can be overriden by source variants. The overriding will be then applied on the phase of generating the configurationm file. Source variants for logging configuration should follow the filename convention: $REPO_HOME/com/baxter/pe/log-componentId-(variantName).xml, where componentId is Price Engine component identifier and variant is a variant part of request URL. section.name: JMS Configuration Source
section.p: This configuration source defines all information related to JMS configuration for Price Engine. This includes configuration of JMS Nodes Instances, authorization and authentication, configuration of channels (topics and queues). List of the channels used by Price Engine components can be found in this document.

subsection.name: Schema
subsection.p: The configuration source groups all settings into three parts: nodes, channels and general settings. Please also refer to XML Schema for more details.
subsection.source: <configuration xmlns="http://baxter-it.com/config/pe/jms"> <node id="node1" host="localhost" port="4001" router="router1"> </node> <node id="node2" host="localhost" port="4002" router="router2"> <authentication username="testUser2" password="test2" /> </node> <queue name="Trade2DB" id="trade2db" node="node1"> <component id="price-engine-broadcast" write="true" /> <component id="price-engine-dbserver" read="true" /> </queue> <queue name="TWC2Server" id="twc2tws" node="node2"> <component id="price-engine-trackwheel" write="true" /> <component id="price-engine-twserver" read="true" /> </queue> <topic name="TWS2Client" id="tws2twc" node="node2"> <component id="price-engine-trackwheel" read="true" /> <component id="price-engine-twserver" write="true" /> </topic> </configuration>
subsection.p: Every node describes a physical JMS instance. This includes the host and port where JMS is running, router, authentication rules etc.
subsection.source: <node id="node2" host="localhost" port="4002" router="router2"> <authentication username="testUser2" password="test2" /> </node>
subsection.p: Channels configuration includes the setup for JMS Topics and Queues. Each channel can be described with channel name and id (used by PE code at runtime). The channel is assigned to a particular JMS node (should be configured there). The list of components which use this channel is provided via nested elements.
subsection.source: <queue name="TWC2Server" id="twc2tws" node="node2"> <component id="price-engine-trackwheel" write="true" /> <component id="price-engine-twserver" read="true" /> </queue> <topic name="TWS2Client" id="tws2twc" node="node2"> <component id="price-engine-trackwheel" read="true" /> <component id="price-engine-twserver" write="true" /> </topic>

subsection.name: Variants
subsection.p: Each configuration element from the source file can be overriden or extended by variant files. The name of variant file should follow this convention: $REPO_HOME/com/baxter/pe/jms(variant).xml, where variant is a variant part of request URL.

section.name: Standard Configuration Source
section.p: This configuration source defines all information related to the components except jms settings. This includes configuration of Property Instances and the component list where they are used.

subsection.name: Schema
subsection.p: The configuration source consist of property settings. Please also refer to XML Schema for more details.
subsection.source:
<properties xmlns="http://baxter-it.com/config/pe/properties" xmlns:c="http://baxter-it.com/config/component">
<property id="runDIServer" value="${pe.devel.config.di}"> <c:component id="price-engine-blotter"/> <c:component id="price-engine-blotterserver"/> </property>
<property id="useDIPanel" value="${pe.devel.config.useDIPanel}"> <c:component id="price-engine-blotter"/> </property>
</properties>
subsection.p: Every node describes a property instance. This includes the name on which the component try to serarch for the value. And the value itself, and the list of components which use this property

subsection.name: Variants
subsection.p: Each configuration element from the source file can be overriden or extended by variant files. The name of variant file should follow this convention: $REPO_HOME/com/baxter/pe/properties(variant).xml, where variant is a variant part of request URL.
Use standard variants overriding rules to define configuration variants. TODO link to standard rules

section.name: Currency and port specification
section.p: Forward controllers, Trackwheel servers, and validtaors are started according the list that is provided by currencies.xml. This file specifies which currencies or currency paris are required to be handled by the conmponent, and the connecton port of it.
The root <configuration> tag can contain 2 different tags <currencyPair> and <currency>

<configuration> tag can be used to specify the currency pairs for any components that requires it. The currency pair is identified by the attribute id of the tag that is a 2 letter code value. Under this tag there are the <port> tags that identify the component that can use the value by the attribute id and contains the port number
The <currency> tag is used for the forward controller to set the port for a curreny in case of interrest rate usage.
The structure of <currency> is the same as the currencyPair's
The value of the component can be required in this case by using the next requests.
